message: Now there is a 50% chance the piece is in each of those squares.
You can split it again, dividing it into three squares (one with 50% chance and two with 25% chance each).
When you click 'Collapse', the piece will collapse and you will know where it is with certanty, breaking the superposition.
Note that this button is not allowed during normal games.
In normal games, pieces collapse when certain actions are performed (more on that later).
You can still move the piece after it's collapsed, but now you know where it is for sure.

initial_message: Now for the more interesting moves.
Click the button (or s on your keyboard) until it reads 'Split' and then select your piece and two target squares.
This move will split the piece into a state of superposition. That means that the piece is in both places at once, and only when collapsing it you'll know where it is with certainty.
